conbody.p: The acquisition of real estate requires the involvement of a DOE Certified Realty Specialist, as specified at 917.7402. Special circumstances and situations may arise under cost-type contracts when, in the performance of the contract or subcontract, the performer shall be required, or otherwise find it necessary, to acquire real estate or interests therein by:
(a) Purchase, on DOE's behalf or in its own name, with title eventually vesting in the Government.
(b) Lease for which DOE will reimburse the contractor for the pre-approved costs incurred under the lease.
(c) Acquisition of temporary interest through easement, license or permit, and DOE funds the cost of the temporary interest.
